summary:
I am a busy-body who is not afraid to seek out new experiences or new challenges. I have studied and worked abroad in South Korea and Scotland. This international experience has helped me to develop my language proficiency and intercultural communication skills. My international experiences also adds to my open-minded approach to people and situations. I seek common ground and try to cross constructed boundaries to build meaningful relationships. Art and creative endeavors are important aspects of my search for common ground that can manifest itself through research topics and interests or the things I create.

In my spare time, I explore my own creativity by drawing and painting, read books whilst drinking a well-roasted freshly ground espresso surrounded by my plant family, practice yoga or solve (indoor) bouldering problems. I like to visit museums, art galleries and film festivals. When I spend time with friends, we cook, eat and enjoy food together.

Gazing Back, Looking Forward: the 'Re-presentation' of Gender Dynamics in North Korean Posters
Intoxicating Youths: Consuming Modernity through Alcohol in 1930s Korea

profile_positions.description:
During my PhD research, I worked on my own individual project. I further developed my analytical skills and critical thinking. I expanded my knowledge on the history of East Asia, medicine and drugs, and critical theory both broadly and deeply. I engaged with different forms of primary and secondary source material and used my analytical- and language skills to analyse these sources.

I learned how to manage a larger project by breaking it down to smaller goals, practice time-management, meet deadlines, and use software to keep track of writing, sources and references. In a stressful environment, I learned how to take care of my mental wellbeing by practicing mindfulness, and by learning where to cross or draw boundaries.

Besides doing research, I engaged with the academic community by participating in international and local conferences and workshops of the History of Medicine and Korean Studies. I also organized a departmental Korean Studies seminar series at Leiden University, took seat in the LIAS-LUCSoR PhD council, and worked as a teaching assistant that gave me the opportunity to teach courses at the BA level.
profile_positions.title: PhD candidate Korean Studies

profile_positions.description:
Assisting Dr. Park with work concerning the BA1 course 'Text, Thought & Culture' and the BA2 course 'Historiography' in the Fall semester of academic year 2017-2018. 

BA1 'Text, Thought & Culture'
- updating the course outline, preparing lectures, teaching materials and exams
- communication with students concerning lectures, homework and exams 
- assisting Dr. Park with grading midterm exams, grading papers and giving personal feedback to students. 
- preparing and teaching Academic Writing Workshop I & II
- preparing and teaching the lecture 'Modern Girls and New Women'
- formulating multiple choice questions for the midterm exam
- formulating resit assignment
- grading the resit final paper

BA2 'Historiography'
- updating the course outline, preparing lectures, teaching materials and written assignments
- communication with students concerning lectures, homework and written assignments
- assisting Dr. Park with grading midterm papers and giving personal feedback to students 
- one-on-one meetings with students to discuss and guide them with written assignments
- preparing and teaching Academic Writing Workshop I & II
- preparing and teaching the lecture 'Biopolitics/History of Medicine'
- preparing and teaching the lecture 'Migration, Identity and Transnational Studies II'
- preparing and teaching the lecture 'Culture and Politics/ Religions/cultural transfer/Confucianism'
- preparing and teaching the lecture 'Hallyu'
- grading the final paper and resit paper
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Werken bij Tabú geeft mij de mogelijkheid om all-round werkzaamheden te verrichten in de bediening en achter de bar.
Zo bedien ik gasten aan tafel, geef uitleg over de menukaart en ben daarbij goed geïnformeerd over eventuele voedselallergieën en dieetrestricties. Daarnaast heb ik all-round bar ervaring. Ik heb een barista-training, wijnproeverij en cocktail workshop gevolgd. de kennis die ik daarbij vergaard heb, pas ik toe in mijn dagelijkse werkzaamheden.
profile_positions.title: Bediening

profile_positions.description: I joined the 24rd annual congress of the European Hematology Association (EHA) in Amsterdam as part of the EHA congress crew. I worked at the EHA booth as booth crew. At the booth, I answered general questions concerning EHA, EBAH (European Board of Accreditation in Hematology), and the congress itself. I helped delegates with signing up for EBAH and assigning their EBAH congress points. I worked together with the EHA staff and other EHA booth crew members.
profile_positions.title: Booth crew

profile_positions.description: As part of Professor James Mills Wellcome Trust Award Investigation ‘The Asian Cocaine Crisis: Pharmaceuticals, Consumers and Control in South & East Asia c1900-1945’, my individual research focuses on the consumption of intoxicants in colonial Korea (1910-1945). In particular, I explore the social and cultural history of cocaine in colonial Korea, informed by theories of gender, the transformable body, and consumption.
profile_positions.title: PhD student History

profile_positions.description: I joined the 23rd annual congress of the European Hematology Association (EHA) in Stockholm as part of the EHA congress crew. I worked at the EHA booth as booth crew. At the booth, I answered general questions concerning EHA, EBAH (European Board of Accreditation in Hematology), and the congress itself. I helped delegates with signing up for EBAH and assigning their EBAH congress points. I worked together with the EHA staff and other EHA booth crew members.
profile_positions.title: Booth crew

profile_positions.description: I assisted Dr. Namhee Han with her work. This included communication through blackboard and email with students, and assisting her with organizing and digitizing her research sources.
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant

profile_positions.description: I assisted Prof.Dr. Remco Breuker with his work. This included assisting him during a conference with North Korean refugees and searching information on international and European policies vis-a-vis North Korea
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant

profile_positions.description:
At Japanmuseum SieboldHuis, I was the first point of contact for visitors of the museum. With my knowledge of the history, culture, art and artifacts of Japan, and my capability to speak several languages (including Japanese), I introduced visitors to the museum and collection and answered their questions.
At the same time, I was a salesperson at the museum shop and fulfilled different tasks during the many events organized at the museum. These tasks included serving drinks and small bites during exhibition openings, tending bar during the annual Leiden Museum Night, helping with framing Japanese woodblock prints for upcoming temporary exhibitions, introducing the guest speakers of seminars and assisting with different workshops. 

During office hours, my position at the front desk of the museum also functioned as the reception desk for the office; I answered phone calls and general emails, received appointments for the museum management, and helped out with small tasks like sending out invitations for exhibition openings.
profile_positions.title: Hostess, Receptionist and Salesperson

profile_positions.description: Conduct interviews, desk and market research in the Netherlands as well as Korea to identify the prospects of the Korean wind energy market.
profile_positions.title: Market Research Intern

volunteer_experiences.role: Project assistant, North Korean Posters online database
volunteer_experiences.description:
Leiden University has digitized over 1200 North Korean posters that belong to the private collection of Willem van der Bijl. I assisted at several points of the digitizing process.
First, I helped with determining the state of the posters before they were scanned. I checked whether the posters were damaged and if there were writings, stamps or marks on the posters that were added after printing.
After the posters had been scanned and ready for adding to the database, I assisted with adding metadata in the database. I focused mainly on summarizing the image and adding metadata related to secondary text that appears on the posters (eg. book titles, newspaper headings, labels of food, details on pins and medals, and secondary slogans). I used my Korean language skills to translate the secondary text and developed my way of describing images by drawing from my knowledge of visual analysis. I took charge in managing the other assistants working on describing and adding metadata of secondary text. I divided the posters between the assistants and drew up a template to standardize the way we described the image of the posters and how to add metadata of secondary text.

During the Open Days of Leiden University, I was the first point of contact for prospective students. I explained the ins and outs of the Korean Studies program with students and their parents. I gave information about different courses, the study load and my elaborated on my experience with studying abroad in South Korea.

volunteer_experiences.role: Student member, Executive Committee of Korean Studies

volunteer_experiences.description: For two consecutive years, I was a student tutor (mentor) for first year Korean Studies students. During a weekly meeting, I and one other student tutor would help the students with their homework for language and content courses. I also helped with questions not directly related to homework or courses. For instance, I informed the students of where they could find things at the university campus and library, or helped them find the right person at the university who could help them with personal issues.

volunteer_experiences.role: Student member, Selection Committee lecturer Art and Visual Culture of Japan
volunteer_experiences.description: As part of the selection committee for a new lecturer in the Japan Studies department, I read motivation letters, cv's, lesson plans and course outlines, and published articles. Together with the selection committee we selected shortlisted candidates and interviewed them. I would also guide the interviewee through Leiden and answer their questions about life in Leiden, the student's perspective etc.

Chairing the Korea Committee of LVSJK Tanuki.
Organizing events related to Korea, for instance a food festival, movie screening, K-pop dance workshops etc.

volunteer_experiences.role: Chairperson committee - Art and Culture Committee
volunteer_experiences.description:
Chairing the Art and Culture Committee of LVSJK Tanuki.
Organizing events related to the art and culture of Japan and Korea, for instance visiting special exhibitions related to Asian Art, visiting the International Film Festival Rotterdam (IFFR), and organizing workshops.

Organizing the freshman introduction camp for new students of Japan and Korean Studies. This included finding a location, organize transportation, do groceries, plan activities, make a schedule for cleaning, and keep the peace while having fun.

Organizing monthly parties. 
This included finding venues, finding a dj, come up with new ideas for themed parties, decorate the venue, promote the parties through various media, door duty and cleaning up afterwards.

Organizing the freshman introduction camp for new students of Japan and Korean Studies. This included finding a location, organize transportation, do groceries, plan activities, make a schedule for cleaning, and keep the peace while having fun.
